text: Start your application today to join Moravian College
Your Application helps us learn about the whole you.

To provide Moravian College with a full picture of what makes you a great candidate, complete an application. It will tell us about your academic history and accomplishments, activities, goals, and more. The application saves your work automatically, so start now and finish later if needed.
Each Incoming Freshman Receives an Apple iPad and MacBook Pro
Moravian College is Now Test Optional

Moravian has taken a holistic approach to application evaluation since its founding, more than 275 years ago. And in the spirit of being a little revolutionary, we’ve taken things a step further by establishing our Test Optional Policy for first-year applicants.
Moravian offers programs of study leading to four baccalaureate degrees—Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Music, Bachelor of Science in Nursing.
Moravian College is committed to making its website accessible to all users. Should you find content that is inaccessible, please contact

Moravian College changed the face of education with its founding in 1742. But we didn’t stop there. After all these years, we’re still pushing boundaries and making history—and encouraging our students to do the same. Are you up for a little revolution?
Choose from 55  bachelor's degree programs or design your own!
Advance your career with one of our 25  graduate degrees and certificates.
Begin a new chapter or finish what you started in our Adult Education program.
Because we won’t stand in your way. Moravian College is for the go-getters. The game-changers and the up-all-nighters. The
kind of students. We want you to be bold and make history. So what are you waiting for?

It’s a bold concept—we know, but remember what we said about being revolutionary? A private college education should be accessible and affordable for everyone, whether you’re pursuing your first bachelor's degree, third masters, or just taking classes for fun. That’s why we award more than $40 million in college-funded financial aid each year, provide fellowship and scholarship resources, and work with local employers to provide graduate program discounts.
Ready for a visit? We would love to have you! Join us on our historic campus in a
, for a personalized tour or open house. Plus, you can meet with one of our admissions counselors to discuss your interests and career goals!

Ready to start your revolution? You'll have to apply first.
Although an interview isn't required, we *strongly* suggest (hint, hint!) you make your way to campus to meet with one of our admission counselors. The best time? Any time, really.
Moravian College is a member of the Common Application group.
Students may apply to Moravian by submitting the
One from school counselor, principal, or other school official
Candidates for admission should be enrolled in a high school college-preparatory curriculum and should complete the following courses by the time they graduate:
Mathematics (four years for students planning to major in the natural sciences or in economics and business)
Natural Sciences (at least two of which must include a laboratory experience)
Electives chosen to prepare for successful study in a liberal arts program
Admission to the Nursing, Art and Music Programs
Prospective nursing majors are required to meet additional prerequisites
Prospective art majors are required to submit a portfolio
of their work along with their application for admission.
an audition is required for admission to the music major
, students who are planning to major in music at Moravian should arrange an audition with the Music Department directly by calling 610-861-1650.

Moravian College recognizes the concept of “course equivalency,” which permits the College to certify the educational value of private study and other out-of-class experiences and, following appropriate evaluation by the College, enables the student to receive academic credit toward a degree. Some ways by which students may receive advanced placement and credit by examination are detailed in the following tables. A maximum of 8 course units for credit by examination, in any combination, may be applied to a Moravian College degree.
Moravian College awards credit to students who have passed at an acceptable level certain Advanced Placement Examinations taken prior to admission. Minimum scores are given below:
Japanese Language and Literature 4 Latin: Literature 4
† The Department of Economics and Business will waive the requirement for Economics 152 upon the student’s completion of both tests with a minimum score of 4.
